Class MatrixOp

java.lang.Object
heparansulfate.MatrixOp
public class MatrixOp extends Object
This class contains a few static methods for matrix and vector operations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    MatrixOp()
    Default constructor

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static double[]
    backwardSubstitution(double[][] a, double[] b)
    Solves the system ax = b, where a is upper triangular
    static double[][]
    cholesky(double[][] A)
    Performs the Cholesky factorization of a symmetric and positive definite matrix A: A = LL^T, where L is lower triangular with positive diagonal elements.
    static double[]
    choleskySolve(double[][] a, double[] b)
    Solves the linear system ax = b, where matrix a is symmetric and positive definite
    static double[]
    forwardElimination(double[][] a, double[] b)
    Solves the linear system ax = b, where a is lower triangular

    • cholesky

      public static double[][] cholesky(double[][] A)
      Performs the Cholesky factorization of a symmetric and positive definite matrix A: A = LL^T, where L is lower triangular with positive diagonal elements. This method returns L
      Parameters:
      A - input matrix (symmetric and positive definite)
      Returns:
      Cholesky factor L of A = LL^T

    • forwardElimination

      Solves the linear system ax = b, where a is lower triangular
      Parameters:
      a - matrix
      b - vector
      Returns:
      solution x to ax = b

      b - vector
      Returns:

    • geInnerProd

      public static double geInnerProd(double[] x, double[] y)
      Computes the inner product between two vectors
      Parameters:
      x - vector of dim n
      y - vector of dim n
      Returns:
      sum_{i=1}^n x_iy_i
